title: Linux git Command with Practical Examples
description: Explore the essential git commands for version control, including initializing a repository, adding and committing files, and managing branches. Gain practical experience with hands-on examples.

meta.title: Linux git Command with Practical Examples
meta.description: Explore the essential git commands for version control, including initializing a repository, adding and committing files, and managing branches. Gain practical experience with hands-on examples.
meta.keywords: Git, Linux, Version Control, Scripting, Programming, Repository, Commit, Branch

verify.name: Verify Git repository initialization
verify.hint: Ensure that you have navigated to the project directory and run the `git init` command to initialize the Git repository.

steps.title: Add and Commit Files to the Git Repository

verify.name: Verify file addition and commit
verify.hint: Ensure that you have created the test.txt file, added it to the Git repository using the `git add` command, and committed the changes using the `git commit` command.

verify.name: Verify branch creation and switching
verify.hint: Ensure that you have created a new branch called `feature/new-page`, made changes to the `test.txt` file, committed the changes, and then switched back to the `master` branch.
